verses.roman:
namo bhagavate tasmai
kṛṣṇāyākuṇṭha-medhase
yat-pādāmburuha-dhyānāt
saṁhitām adhyagām imām

synonyms: namaḥ—obeisances; bhagavate—to the Supreme Personality of Godhead; tasmai—to Him; kṛṣṇāya—Lord Śrī Kṛṣṇa; akuṇṭha-medhase—whose power is never impeded; yat—whose; pāda-ambu-ruha—upon the lotus feet; dhyānāt—by meditation; saṁhitām—the scripture; adhyagām—I have assimilated; imām—this.
translation: I offer my obeisances to the Supreme Personality of Godhead, the invincible Lord Śrī Kṛṣṇa. Simply by meditating upon His lotus feet I have been able to study and appreciate this great literature.
